quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Episode and The X-men
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, field, patricks. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Dr. Adler, the scientist in the X-Men series who claimed to have a cure for mutation, was actually which character in disguise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mystique

questions.question: Who is the dragon that Family Guy character Peter slays to free the village?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cybill Shepherd

questions.question: The first episode of Will  Grace began with which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a phone call

questions.question: What was the name of Jacks son on the sitcom Will  Grace?

options.text: He did not have a son

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elliot

questions.question: In the TV series Will  Grace, what song did Karen make Will perform in a piano bar in exchange for her making him her lawyer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Honestly Love You

questions.question: In the episode The Days of Future Past, the X-Men travel to the Savage Land, only to find that their mutant powers have been nullified. What card does Gambit fail to charge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5 of Diamonds

questions.question: In an episode of the X-Men, titled “Unstoppable Juggernaut”, what mutant always ends up at the wrong place at the wrong time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colussus

questions.question: What is the half dead fat guy eating in Patricks room at the end of the Family Guy episode titled The Fat Guy Strangler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a dead fat guy

questions.question: After Senator Kelly is elected president in the X-Men series, what is his first act in office?

options.text: A Full Pardon of Dr. Hank McCoy
Ordering an invasion of the X-Mansion

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Full Pardon of Dr. Hank McCoy

questions.question: In the X-Men animated series, after attempting to rescue a mutant from a mob of civilians, Cyclops and Jean Grey are kidnapped by what underground mutant society?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Morlocks

questions.question: In the X-Mens first trip to the field during season 1, Beast is left behind together with what oter member of the X-Men team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morph

questions.question: In Slave Island, an episode of the X-men, which character pretends to be betraying his friends in order to help them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gambit

questions.question: What has been Mexicos favourite toy for over 340 years according to the Family Guy episode The Fat Guy Strangler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a ball in a cup

questions.question: This character in the X-Men series, sent by Magneto to destroy the X-Mansion, is a former enemy of Wolverine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sabretooth

questions.question: In one of the episodes of the X-Men, Morph calls the X-Men to his show, so he can talk to them. What is the name of the?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: 70s and Grace
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, tv. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Before creating That 70s show, Bonnie and Terry Turner were famous for this Emmy Award-winning sitcom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3rd Rock from the Sun

questions.question: Which actor, famous for his portrayal of hippies, plays Stephen Hydes boss Leo in That 70s Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy Chong

questions.question: In all, how many women did Will have sex with on the popular show Will  Grace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: one

questions.question: On the sitcom Will  Grace, in a sexual harassment training video for employees, Jack starred as the boss that makes an inappropriate gesture  toward Karen, the employee and his co-star. What was this gesture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tongue in the ear

questions.question: Actor Topher Grace had to quit That 70s Show before its final season in order to prepare for a role in this movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spider-Man 3

questions.question: Which sci-fi classic does the character Eric Forman from That 70s show name as his favourite movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Wars

questions.question: What was the name of Karens stepson in the TV series Will  Grace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mason

questions.question: How old was Mila Kunis when she first auditioned for That 70s Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was 14

questions.question: What does Grace from Will  Grace call Joan Collins?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taco eater

questions.question: What did Grace, one of the main characters on Will  Grace, proclaim after finding out she ate dog food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Needs Salt

questions.question: What is the main characters usual hangout place in That 70s Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a basement

questions.question: On the TV show Will  Grace, Jack came out to his mom on which holiday?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thanksgiving

questions.question: Seth Green played a recurring character in That 70s show. Later, he and one of the shows stars, Mila Kunis, voiced a brother and sister in this animated comedy serial.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Family Guy

questions.question: What Wisconsin town does the sitcom That 70s Show take place in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Point Place

questions.question: What was the name of the crazy kleptomaniac, played by Molly Shannon on the sitcom Will  Grace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Valerie

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Stooges and Bell
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Approximately how many shorts did the Three Stooges make for Columbia Pictures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2000

questions.question: What animated series featured The Three Stooges?

options.text: The Three Stooges Go Around the World in a Daze

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Three Robonic Stooges

questions.question: Larry Fine, a member of The Three Stooges had what special clause in his contract?

options.text: He was not allowed to change his hairstyle.
He had to stop playing his violin.
He was not allowed to hit Moe.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had to stop playing his violin.

questions.question: Joe Besser, a member of the Stooges from 1957 to 1959, had what special clause in his contract?

options.text: He had to be photographed on his left side.
He had to have his last name on the list of all credits.
He could not be hit very hard.
He could not be publicly insulted.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He could not be hit very hard.

questions.question: What was the name of the mascot on the teen TV series Saved by the Bell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tigers

questions.question: How many seasons did the teen sitcom Saved by the Bell run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5

questions.question: How many different actors appeared as The Three Stooges in the long history of the trio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: In what way is military man, Michael Fleming related to The Three Stooges?

options.text: He is the author of their authorized biography.
He directed many of their full-length movies.
He was producer of many of their full-length movies.
He is the only living descendant of any of the Stooges.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is the author of their authorized biography.

questions.question: Where does the name of the Stooges come from?

options.text: It is an old Joe Palooka movie

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is a vaudeville act

questions.question: Which actress played Stacey Carosi in the teen sitcom Saved by the Bell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leah Remini

questions.question: Did Screech win the Miss Bayside pageant in the teen TV series Saved by the Bell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The Three Stooges were in a slump by the end of the 1950s. What renewed their careers?

options.text: The demand for comedy increased enormously in the 50s.
Columbia Pictures released the shorts in a tape form.
Columbia Pictures sold the rights to their shorts to Warner Brothers.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The TV generation rediscovered them.

questions.question: What is the relation between the computer software company, Cinemaware, and The Three Stooges?

options.text: They made a computer game featuring the Stooges.
They released all of the Stooges shorts on the Internet.
They sponsored a Three Stooges Hall of Fame in Hollywood.
They made a computer database for all of the Stooges appearances.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They made a computer game featuring the Stooges.

questions.question: Which actor was initially cast to play Red Forman on That 70s show, but couldnt do it due to a scheduling conflict?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chuck Norris

questions.question: What was the title of the British remake of That 70s Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Days Like These

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Animal

questions.question: When did The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air air?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: September 10, 1990-May 20, 1996

questions.question: Why didnt Jada Pinkett get the role of Lisa on the show The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air?

options.text: because Will Smith didnt want to give her the role
because she was engaged to Will Smith
because she was pregnant with the couples first child

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: because she was too short

questions.question: Lou Grant from the self-titled show takes the newspaper job after being fired from his TV job in the WJM news department. Where was WJM news department situated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minneapolis

questions.question: When did the show Lou Grant air?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: September 20, 1977 - September 13 , 1982

questions.question: How many times did Nancy Marchand win the Emmy for Outstanding Actress in a Supporting Role for her performance on the show Lou Grant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: Who was not one of the creators of the show Lou Grant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norman Lear

questions.question: Which company produced the TV series Lou Grant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MTM

questions.question: Which network aired the show Lou Grant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: CBS

questions.question: Which statement regarding the series Lou Grant is untrue?

options.text: Many journalism classes were shortened or cancelled so the students and teachers could  watch the show.
The shows star was very outspoken about the USAs part in the politics in El Salvador.
The star of the show blamed President Reagan for the shows cancellation.
The ratings were the reason for the shows cancellation in 1984.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The ratings were the reason for the shows cancellation in 1984.

questions.question: Who played Joe  Rossi, the investigative reporter on the TV show Lou Grant?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Walden
